org.vle.aid.metadata
Interface RepositoryFactoryImpl

All Known Implementing Classes:
JenaRepositoryFactoryImpl, Sesame2RepositoryFactoryImpl
public interface RepositoryFactoryImpl

This class is part of the Factory design pattern to allow the dynamic and configurable instantiation of the Repository class with various implementations of the Repository, e.g. Sesame, Jena, etc.

Author:
wrvhage

Method Summary
 Repository createRepository()
          This method creates an uninitialized Repository.
 Repository createRepository(String server, String repository, String username, String password)
          This method produces a Repository with login information.
 Repository createRepository(String server, String repository, String username, String password, String rdf_format)
          This method produces a Repository with login information and a preferred RDF serialization format.
 

Method Detail

createRepository

Repository createRepository()
This method creates an uninitialized Repository.

createRepository

Repository createRepository(String server,
                            String repository,
                            String username,
                            String password)
This method produces a Repository with login information.

Parameters:
server_url - the URL of the meta-data server that will be queried (e.g. http://www.host.org:8080/sesame)
repository - the name of the repository or model in the meta-data server (e.g. mem-rdfs-db)
username - the username of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. testuser)
password - the password of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. opensesame)

createRepository

Repository createRepository(String server,
                            String repository,
                            String username,
                            String password,
                            String rdf_format)
This method produces a Repository with login information and a preferred RDF serialization format.

Parameters:
server_url - the URL of the meta-data server that will be queried (e.g. http://www.host.org:8080/sesame)
repository - the name of the repository or model in the meta-data server (e.g. mem-rdfs-db)
username - the username of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. testuser)
password - the password of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. opensesame)
rdf_format - the encoding of the RDF (e.g. rdfxml, turtle, ntriples, etc.)
